name: Padora
subline: A superflexible and responsive Multi-purpose Theme

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content:
Requirements

The following things are required to run this product:
  • PHP 5.3 or higher
  • MySQL 5+
  • GD Library
  • Self-Hosted WordPress 4.x
  • Experience using WordPress functions

Forum Support

All of our items come with free support, and we have a dedicated support forum to handle your requests. Support is limited to questions regarding the theme’s features or problems with the theme. We are unable to provide support for code customization or third-party plugins. We may help you to do minor customizations and we are very appreciated if you have any feature request/suggestion.
 
Go to our forum: http://linethemes.com/forums

Recommended

This theme supports the following external plugins to provide functionality:

  • bbPress
  • Contact Form 7
  • Easy Pricing Tables Lite by Fatcat Apps
  • LayerSlider WP
  • Revolution Slider
  • ThemeKit by LineThemes
  • WooCommerce
  • WPBakery Visual Composer

sections.title: Theme Installation
sections.content:
Once you've downloaded the installation file on ThemeForest, extract it and locate a file called Padora.zip. You can install the theme by using one of two installation methods:

Install by WordPress Theme Manager

This is probably the simplest way for most users. Here are the steps you need to take:

  1. Login to your admin page.
  2. Navigate to Appearance > Themes.
  3. Click Add New
  4. Then click Upload Theme
  5. Next, Browse to the zip file and click Install now for the theme to be uploaded and installed.
  6. After done installing, click Activate the theme

Install through FTP upload

If you wish to install via FTP, here are the steps you need to take:

  1. Using FTP client, login to the server where your WordPress website is hosted
  2. Using FTP client, navigate to the /wp-content/themes/ directory under your WordPress website's root directory
  3. Using FTP client, upload the Padora directory to themes directory on remote server

Once installation is complete, your Padora theme will be ready to use.

Install Plugins

The theme requires the following plugin: ThemeKit by LineThemes, WPBakery Visual Composer and recommends the following plugins: Revolution Slider, LayerSlider WP, bbPress, Contact Form 7, Easy Pricing Tables Lite by Fatcat Apps, WooCommerce

After activating the theme, you will be asked to installed the required and recommended plugins, you can proceed by clicking on Begin installing plugins

In the next page, check all the plugins that you want to install then on the drop down Bulk Actions, choose Install then click Apply, the plugin installation process will start.

After install plugins, go to Appearance > Install Plugins, check all the plugins that you want to activate then on the drop down Bulk Actions, choose Activate and click Apply, the plugin activation process will start. Wait for all the plugin activated then you can start customizing your website as you wish

If you installed Woocommerce plugin, please navigate to Appearance > Themes, click on Install WooCommerce Pages button to set up WooCommerce for your shopping cart

Install Sample Data

Go to Appearance > Sample Data, on the next page, click Install Sample Data button.

A popup dialog will appear and ask for confirmation, you can check the Agreement box and click Install Sample Data button to continue
 
Note:
Installing sample data will delete all data on this website.
It is NOT recommended to install sample data on production website.

sections.title: Theme Customization
sections.content:
To start customization Padora theme, in the admin page please go to Appearance > Customize

Note: Please remember to click Save & Publish button at top left after done customizing to save the changes
Note: These are global settings so its effect is site-wide. These settings can be overridden in single post or page

General

  1. Site Information
    • Site Name: Your site name
    • Site Tagline: A few words to description your site
  2. Static Front Page
    • Static Front Page: This option allow switch between Static Page or Blog Page that will appearing on the home page
    • Front Page: Select the page that will display as home of your site
    • Posts Page: Select the page that will display blog posts
  3. Misc
    • Enable Go Top Button: Turn on/off for go to top button
    • Tracking Code: Input your google analytics ID or script to track the site on Google
    • Custom Favicon: You can select or upload your custom favicon
    • Social Links: Just click to the icon and provide the URL that you wish display it on header or footer

Header

To setup header layout, please navigate to Appearance > Customize > Header section and choose one of available layouts. You can setup some other things that we listed below:

  1. Custom Logo
    • Use Logo Image: When this option was turned on, the logo on header will be use a custom image instead of your site name
    • Display Site Tagline: Turn on this option to show site tagline below logo position on the header
    • Logo: The custom logo image
    • Stick Header Logo: The custom logo image that will display on header when user scrolling down
    • Logo Size: Input your logo dimension
    • Logo Margin: Input the top/bottom margin for logo
  2. Navigator
    • Primary Menu: On the dropdown box, choose a menu as main menu.
  3. Header Style
    • Header Style: On the dropdown box, choose a style for the header
    • Use Header Dark Style: You can turn this option on/off to switch between dark/light header style
    • Enable Header Sticky: Enable this option to stick the header to top of pages when scrolling down
    • Dark Style For Stick Header: Enable dark style for stick header
    • Show Cart Menu: Enable this option to show cart icon on the primary menu (This option require woocommerce installed)
    • Show Search Menu: Enable this option to show search icon on the primary menu
    • Show Off-Canvas Menu: Enable this option to show icon to toggle off-canvas menu on the primary menu
  4. Topbar
    • Enable Topbar: Turn on/off this option to show/hide the topbar
    • Topbar Background: Select the color for the topbar
    • Topbar Text Color: Select the color for the text on topbar
    • Content: Enter your content that you wish to display on the topbar
    • Enable Social Links: Turn on/off this option to show/hide social links on the topbar (The social links are configured on general section)

Footer

Footer was divided into 3 different sections: Page Callout, Widgets and Copyright & Social icons. One screenshot below you will see explanation of what is what:

  1. Page Callout
    • Enable Page Callout: Turn on/off the page callout section
    • Content: The content of the page callout
    • Button Text: Custom text for callout button (e.g: GET IT NOW)
    • Button Link: Link of the button
    • Button Target: Link target of the callout button
    • Button Addition Class: You can add extra classes to the callout button
    • Background Color: Background color for page callout
    • Text Color: Text color for page callout
    Note: You can change the button style from dark to light by adding class "btn-outline-white"
  2. Footer Widgets
    • Enable Footer Widgets: Turn on/off to show/hide the footer widgets area
    • Widgets Layout: You can select how many areas to be displayed on footer widgets section. To customize areas layout, just drag it to match as you wish
    • Widgets Background: Customize background for this section, it can be a solid color, image pattern or custom image
    • Text Color: Select the text color for this section
  3. Custom Footer
    • Enable Social Links: Turn on/off to show/hide the social links on this section
    • Copyright: Just type the text that you wish to be displayed on footer copyright area

Layout & Styles

In the section Layout & Styles, we are provide options to customize the theme layout and styles.

  1. Scheme Color

    With this option, you can change unlimited color for your site

  2. Layout
    • Display Style: You can choose between Boxed and Full width layouts
    • Boxed Background: With the boxed layout, you can modify page background with this option
    • Content Width: Maximum width of the content area
  3. Sidebar
    • Sidebar Position: Select the position of the sidebar that will displayed on page
    • Default Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to display at the sidebar position selected above
  4. Page Title
    • Enable Page Title: Turn on/off to show/hide the page title
    • Background: You can modify the background of the page title with a solid color, image pattern or custom image
    • Text Color: Select the text color that will displayed on page title
    • Breadcrumb Prefix: Enter prefix text for the breadcrumb
    • Breadcrumb Separator: Enter the character that you wish to use as separator of the breadcrumb

Typography

  1. Body Font: You can select the font family, color, size or weight for the body text
  2. Headings Font: You can select the font family, color, size or weight for the heading text
  3. Menu Font: You can select the font family, color, size or weight for the menu text
  4. Font Subsets: Turn on/off to load extra subsets for the font

Blog

  1. Page Title
    • Enable Page Title: Turn on/off for show/hide page title on the posts page
    • Blog Page Title: You can modify the title for posts page
  2. Blog List
    • List Sidebar Position: Select sidebar postion on the posts page
    • Blog List Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to displayed on posts page
    • List Layout: Select the layout for the posts page
    • Grid Columns: When selected list layout is grid/masonry you can modify how many columns will be displayed
    • Auto Post Excepts: When turn on this option, The post content will be truncated automatically on posts page
    • Post Excepts Length: This option will be available when turn on "Auto Post Excepts". It will be used to limit the content length show on posts page
    • Show Post Meta: Turn on/off to show/hide the post meta
    • Show Read More: Turn on/off to show/hide read more button
    • Read More Text: You can modify the text of read more button
    • Pagination Style: Select the style of pagination links on posts page
    • Posts Per Page: Enter the number of posts that will be displayed on posts page
  3. Blog Single
    • Single Sidebar Position: Select sidebar position on the single blog post
    • Blog Single Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to displayed on single blog post
    • Show Post Navigator: Turn on/off to show/hide the post navigator
    • Post Navigator Sticky: Turn on this option to make post navigator to stick
    • Show Author Box: Turn on to show the author box on below post content
    • Show Related Posts: Turn ON to show the related posts box
    • Related Posts Style: Select style for the related posts box
    • Columns Of Related Posts: Select how many columns of posts will be displayed on the related posts box
    • Number Of Related Posts: Enter the number of posts that you wish to display on the related posts box

Portfolio

  1. Page Title
    • Enable Page Title: Turn on/off for show/hide page title on the portfolio page
    • Custom Page Title: You can modify the page title that listing portfolio items
  2. Portfolio List
    • List Sidebar Position: Select sidebar postion on the portfolio listing page
    • Portfolio List Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to displayed on the portfolio listing page
    • List Layout: Select the layout for the portfolio listing page
    • Grid Columns: When selected list layout is grid/masonry you can modify how many columns will be displayed
    • Show Items Filter: Turn ON/OFF to show/hide the portfolio filter
    • Pagination Style: Select the style of pagination links on the portfolio listing page
    • Posts Per Page: Enter the number of posts that will be displayed on the portfolio listing page
  3. Portfolio Single
    • Single Sidebar Position: Select sidebar position on the portfolio single
    • Portfolio Single Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to displayed on the portfolio single
    • Show Single Navigator: Turn on/off to show/hide the portfolio navigator
    • Single Navigator Sticky: Turn on this option to make portfolio navigator to stick
    • Show Related Portfolios: Turn ON to show the related portfolios box
    • Related Portfolio Style: Select style for the related portfolios box
    • Grid Columns: Select how many columns of portfolio items will be displayed on the related portfolios box
    • Number Of Related Portfolios: Enter the number of portfolio items that you wish to display on the related portfolios box

Woocommerce

  1. Product Listing
    • Sidebar Position: Select sidebar postion on the products listing page
    • Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to displayed on the products listing page
    • Products Per Page: Enter the number of products that will be displayed on the products listing page
  2. Product Details
    • Sidebar Position: Select sidebar postion on the product details page
    • Sidebar: On the dropdown box, select the sidebar that you wish to displayed on the product details page
    • Show Related Products: Turn ON to show the related products box
    • Number Of Related Products: Enter the number of products that you wish to display on the related products box

Under Construction

  1. Enable Under Construction: Turn ON this option to enable under construction mode
  2. Under Construction Page: On the dropdown box, select the page that will be used for under construction page
  3. Allowed Access For Roles: Checked to the roles that can access to your site

Widgets

This section can be used to edit/add/reorder widgets

sections.title: Blog Posts
sections.content:
To create a new blog post, go to Posts > Add New from the admin panel.

  1. Enter a title for your post in the text field near the top.
  2. Next, at the right side of your screen, in the section called Format, choose a format for your blog post. Let's go over the possible options:
    • Standard: This is the default blog format. You can start adding content with the Visual Editor.
    • Gallery: When select this format, a image slider will be created on top of the page. All images of slider must be added to field "Gallery Images" on box "Post Options"
    • Link: When select this format, the post title will be linked to the URL that you entered in the field "External Link" on the box "Post Options"
    • Quote: This format will make post to show look like a quote.
    • Video: When select this format, a video player will be created on top of the page. The video URL must be added to field "Video URL" on box "Post Options"
    • Audio: When select this format, a audio player will be created on top of the page. The audio URL must be added to field "Audio URL" on box "Post Options"

Now it's time to categorize this post.

  1. Under Format, in the section called Categories, select the categories that you wish to add this post to. Alternatively, if you'd like to create a new category, click on "+ Add New Category" A text field will unfold where you can enter a name for the category.
  2. Then click on "Add New Category".
  3. Once you've checked the categories where you want this post to go to, click the "Publish button".
  4. Under the Categories section are the Tags and Featured Image sections. Here you can add tags to your post, and upload an image to be displayed for this post on blog list pages, respectively.

Now that you've set up your blog post

sections.title: Pages Management
sections.content:
Creating your own page has been never so easy. To make the first step please go to Pages > Add new. On first sight everything looks just like in default wordpress. But when you have a look under Visual/HTML area you will see some Page options or on Page Attribute panel, you can see some Page templates that we are explained below.

Page Templates

When creating a new page, one of the first things you might want to do is to assign an appropriate template for it. To do this, go inside the page backend and locate the section on the right called Page Attributes. Bridge comes with a variety of templates to choose from:

  1. Default Template: Choose this one if you wish to create a standard page
  2. Blog: Choose this one if you wish to create a page to listing posts
  3. Portfolio: Choose this one if you wish to create a page to listing portfolio
  4. Page - Blank: Choose this one if you wish to create a page without header and footer
  5. Page - Fullwidth: Choose this one if you wish to create a page that content width will stretch to fit browser width

Page Options

Beside the page templates, we are provide specific options for a page. All page options will be override the global options of theme. With "Blog" and "Portfolio" templates we have two respective sections that contains options for customize it.

  1. General
    • Page Cover: This is an special option, it allow to input any content as you wish. The entered content will be displayed on top of the page, page header will show at below. e.g: The slider of page "Header Below Slider" is the page cover
    • Styles: When enable this option, you can override the scheme color of theme
    • Layout: When enable this option, you can override the layout settings
    • Page Header: When enable this option, you can override the page title settings
  2. Header
    • Top Bar: When enable this option, you can override the top bar settings
    • Custom Header: When enable this option, you can override the header settings
    • Custom Logo: Of course, sometime we need to create a page with a special logo, just turn on this options for allow to do it
    • Navigator: To assign a custom menu to this page, please turn this ON
  3. Footer
    • Page Callout: Turn this ON to override page callout settings
    • Footer Widgets: Turn this ON to change the footer widgets styles
    • Custom Footer: Turn ON to modify copyright content, show/hide social links
  4. Portfolio

    This section will be activated when selected page template is "Portfolio"

    • List Layout: Select the layout for listing the portfolio
    • Grid Columns: How many columns will be displayed
    • Show Portfolio Filter: Show/hide the portfolio filter
    • Pagination Style: Style for the pagination links
    • Posts Per Page: Number of posts will be shown per page
  5. Blog

    This section will be activated when selected page template is "Blog"

    • List Layout: Select the layout for the posts page
    • Grid Columns: When selected list layout is grid/masonry you can modify how many columns will be displayed
    • Auto Post Excepts: When turn on this option, The post content will be truncated automatically on posts page
    • Post Excepts Length: This option will be available when turn on "Auto Post Excepts". It will be used to limit the content length show on posts page
    • Show Post Meta: Turn on/off to show/hide the post meta
    • Show Read More: Turn on/off to show/hide read more button
    • Read More Text: You can modify the text of read more button
    • Pagination Style: Select the style of pagination links on posts page
    • Posts Per Page: Enter the number of posts that will be displayed on posts page

sections.title: Portfolio Management
sections.content:
Adding Portfolio Item

To create a new portfolio item, go to:

  1. From admin panel go to Portfolio > Add New.
  2. Enter a title for your portfolio item in the text field near the top.
  3. Next, let's categorize this item. At the right side of your screen, in the section called Portfolio Categories, select the categories that you wish to add this item to. Alternatively, if you'd like to create a new category, click on "+ Add New Portfolio Category." A text field will unfold where you can enter a name for the category.
  4. Then click on "Add New Portfolio Category".
  5. Once you've checked the categories where you want this item to go to, click the "Publish" button.

Under the Portfolio Categories section are the Portfolio Tags and Featured Image sections. In Featured Image, you can upload an image to be displayed for this item on portfolio lists. And in Portfolio Tags, you can enter tags for this item.

Now that you've set up your portfolio item, let's go to discover the Portfolio Options.

  1. Cover Images/Videos: This options are allowed to add images/videos to be used as cover of portfolio item

    • Cover Style: Style of portfolio cover
    • Animation Type: With cover "Slider" we can select the animation type, it can be Fade or Slide
    • Grid Columns: Select how many columns of images/videos will be displayed

  2. Content Layout

    • Content Position: Select the position that portfolio content will be shown
    • Enable Content Sticky: Turn thi ON to make portfolio content stick when scrolling down

  3. Details Information

    • Client: Your client's name
    • Website: Your client's website
    • Project URL: Link to the project that you have done

sections.title: Mega Menus
sections.content:
You can easily create some simple mega menus with columns by simply adding a couple classes to your parent menu item. Just follow this steps:

  1. Create your menu.
  2. Add the classname "line-megamenu" to the parent item you want to have a mega menu dropdown on.
  3. Nest items that you to be a part of your mega menu under the parent item mentioned previously.
  4. Nest items under eachother to create multiple columns (multiple dropdowns). Each sub-dropdown will become 1 column.

Your mega menu should look something like the screenshot below (The columns dependent how many subitems you added from parent menu).

Need the icons for menu items?

 

Adding icon for menu items is very easy, we just need adding class to the field "CSS Classes" of menu item.

e.g:

You can see the all supported icons from FontAwesome

Can't find the CSS field for menu items?

It's probably just disabled, enable it in the "screen options" tab.

sections.title: Shortcodes
sections.content:
Padora are built with several custom shortcodes that will make life easy when creating content. To use the custom shortcodes, just open up visual composer and add element you need to be used.

 

There are list of shortcodes you can be used beside Visual Composer's elements:

  1. Alert Message (Preview)
  2. Buttons (Preview)
  3. Call To Action (Preview)
  4. Columns (Preview)
  5. Countdown & Counter (Preview)
  6. Contact Form (Preview)
  7. Dividers (Preview)
  8. Image & Animations (Preview)
  9. Image Box (Preview)
  10. Image Gallery (Preview)
  11. Icons (Preview)
  12. Icon Box (Preview)
  13. Icon List (Preview)
  14. Maps (Preview)
  15. Media Grid (Preview)
  16. Open Hours (Preview)
  17. Parallax (Preview)
  18. Pricing Table (Preview)
  19. Progress Bars & Charts (Preview)
  20. Tabs & Tours (Preview)
  21. Toggle & Accordions (Preview)
  22. Testimonial (Preview)
  23. Recent Portfolio (Preview)
  24. Recent Posts (Preview)
  25. Video Player (Preview)
  26. Member (Preview)

sections.title: Sidebars Management
sections.content:
This theme has by default 6 sidebar areas for use:

  1. Primary Sidebar: This is default sidebar, it will be displayed on left or right of page dependent the sidebar layout option.
  2. Off-Canvas Sidebar: This is a special area, it allow to display widgets as content inside the off-canvas menu
  3. Footer Sidebar #1 to #4: This areas will be used to display on footer widgets

Beside the built-in sidebar areas, we're provided a feature called "Custom Sidebar". With this feature, you can create a unlimited sidebar areas. To create a custom sidebar, just navigate to Appearance > Widgets and look to right side of the page you will see the box "Create Widget Area". Enter the sidebar title as you wish and click to "Create" button, a custom sidebar will be created

To remove a custom sidebar, in Appearance > Widgets please open the sidebar that you wish to remove. Click button "remove this are" to remove it

sections.title: Advanced Settings
sections.content: Padora theme provide a special sections that allow to add custom CSS and Javascript to the theme. Just navigate to Appearance > Advanced and start adding custom code.

sections.title: Contact Form
sections.content: Contact forms are not built into a theme (for many reasons) so we recommend using a 3rd party plugin for this. The free one we like is Contact Form 7 it can be used to add forms anywhere on your site!
